intro: Leucosyke elmeri, commonly known as Elmer's leucosyke, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Leucosyke elmeri is often found in association with other moisture-loving plants in its native habitat.
